reviews: Not Verified |  With Newark Airport experiencing so many problems right now, I asked AA to change a flight for my 88 year old mother who will be flying this weekend. I asked for them to change her to a flight traveling to Lehigh Valley vs. Newark to forego any unforeseen problems. Due to her flight being a basic economy, I was told no. I asked to speak to a manager, was given one, then told managers above that level don't accept phone calls. The absolute unwillingness to help an 88 year old woman, and the complete lack of customer service has turned me off to AA forever. We will never fly this airline again.

Not Verified |  Absolutely unacceptable experience with American Airlines. Our Friday evening flight was delayed from 7:00 PM to 11:00 PM, pushing our arrival to 1:30 AM—well past our car rental pickup window. Since my wife had plans to stay with her aunt, we accepted American’s offer to reschedule for a 9:00 AM flight the next morning. We rearranged our entire trip—appointments, schedules, everything—around that new plan. Then, without warning, the morning flight was delayed again… to 5:00 PM. At that point, the entire purpose of our trip was ruined. We had to cancel everything, and now there’s absolutely no reason to even go. American Airlines completely derailed our plans, wasted our time, and left us with zero confidence in their ability to manage or communicate effectively. This was our last time flying with you. Never again.

Not Verified |  First delay happened in Arkansas. Was delayed by about an hour. Got to DFW late for connecting flight. That got delayed and then canceled, rebooted delayed canceled, rebooted, delayed canceled, rebooted again and still wound up having to stay in DFW for over 12 HOURS. Got told that they don't do refunds, which is actually against their own published policy. Basically, a 5 and a half hour total time flight turned into a 17 +/- hour long flight. While I was left stranded at DFW, I witnessed several other flights being canceled for various reasons.

✅ Trip Verified |   I was desperate to get to Arizona in 2023 to help my son who was experiencing a very serious health crisis and was in an extremely dangerous situation. The agents basically shut the doors in my face and were not helpful, kind or understanding. The situation required me to get on the most immediate flight on any airline that would get me there as soon as possible. Eventually, I was given a flight credit but American Airline did not explain the short nature of the credit and never sent a courtesy email or anything. Now I find out they have erased my credit. I don't expect the airline to care enough about me to do anything so flying American would bring up many bad feelings and memories.

✅ Trip Verified |   Travelling first class on a domestic flight within America is typically not something to write home about. That is – unless you’re flying with American Airlines from LAX to JFK. If so, make sure to fly on their direct flight with an Airbus A321 aircraft that was specifically designed and configured for these transcontinental flights. In fact, it has it’s on aircraft type – an A321T (the T stands for Transcontinental). First Class is a separate cabin at the font of the aircraft. Here you’ll find 10 individual first-class open suite - 5 rows with one on either side so each has windows and direct aisle access. This was quite a surprise for a single aisle narrow body jet. There was one dedicated flight attendant for all 10 passengers so kept pretty busy for the entire flight. He was bright and attentive. The breakfast meal was a pretty average affair but my expectations were low based on the airline’s reputation. The seat converts to a full lay-flat bed and was very comfortable and with fluffy pillows and blanket. I fell asleep easily and slept well for a few hours and woke to the smell of cookies being freshly baked in the forward galley. This was a nice touch and something the flight attendant clearly enjoyed doing. The wait for the luggage to arrive at the belt was particularly long and stressful when you are getting constant phone calls from your driver to check if it’s arrived.

Not Verified |   Do not travel on American Airlines unless you have no other choice which was and is my case. This review refers only to American Airlines telephone customer service; before my return trip next week I needed to ask AA something concern my flight. The local number that I had is disconnected and no new number provided. Consequently I had to make a long distance overseas call for which I was billed long distance telephone charges that lasted almost fifteen minutes before the AA representative was able to give a local number which was not disconnected.

✅ Trip Verified |   I knew there was something wrong with the entertainment system before we left LAX because I had watched the huddle of technicians from my seat. They had removed the cover off a rather large panel and were pushing buttons and muttering. My suspicions were confirmed when there was no safety video and they did it the old fashioned way with the crew standing in the aisle with an oxygen mask in one hand and a life vest around their necks. However, they didn’t say a word about it to the passengers until we were in the air and well on our way to Sydney. I guess they figured the reaction of learning you faced 15 hours without movies, music or games would be less in the air than on the ground. Well, at least I could enjoy the leisurely pace of the first class meal service; so I thought. But clearly the 2 male flight attendants looking after the first class cabin had better things to do. The service was practically over before it began. The courses came so fast I could barely keep up and the food was terrible. All in all it was one of the worst flights I’ve had in years and the 2 guys looking after first class should retire and pass the mantle to someone less jaded.
✅ Trip Verified |   Had a great flight in from Tampa on our way to 5 national parks in Utah. Chance and Erico were fantastic, spectacular service and took great care of us.

Not Verified |  My daughter and I were traveling from Norfolk VA to Boston MA on April 8, 2025. We had a flight that was suppose to depart at 8:06AM leaving from Norfolk with a connection in Philadelphia then on to Boston arriving around 10:30-11am. We were at the Norfolk airport at 7am waiting for our flight to board when the 1st delay was announced for 2 hours. We went up to the ticket counter and the agent was able to rebook us on a different connecting flight only delaying us about 2 hours. The second delay of 6 hours was announced about an hour before the second boarding was suppose to happen. And the announcement was to call American customer service to rebook again. I did call customer service and was rebooked on a different flight going to Laguardia airport and we had to wait 3 hours for this flight to depart. This short flight on a smaller plane was extremely turbulent on the last half and my daughter and I were so nauseated and exhausted. The layover in Laguardia was another 2-3 hours. At least Laguardia had a nice food court and we were able to sit and have lunch. The flight to Boston was uneventful.  I am very disappointed in the delays and handling of passengers by American Airlines. This delay should have been called much earlier. They announced it was due to mechanical issues. Why not inspect the planes more frequently and cancel flights at least 6-8 hours before the flight departs if any issues. That way passengers can be rebooked and notified ahead of time. And if this does happen last minute airlines should be required to offer cash or gift card or something. It was a horrible experience and day and one I will never forget. I plan on never flying with American again. And I will be letting my friends and family know what a bad experience this was so that this does not happen to them. I was not the only angry and disappointed passenger. I overheard other passengers stating this happens alot with American airlines,

✅ Trip Verified |   I have flown five flights with American Airlines in the last 4 months. Each one has been delayed over 5 hours for mechanical problems. When you contact American Airlines they don't care they just blow you off. They don't care that they're delaying you missing appointments and connections.

✅ Trip Verified |   My flight was originally for 6:15 am, this flight was delayed. I was issued a new ticket that required me to be stranded in Phoenix Arizona for 11 hours. I was originally supposed to arrive at my destination (Minneapolis) at 2:14 pm. My 6 hour trip turned into an all day event. Also, I just got word that my flight to Phoenix is, once again, delayed. I spent a lot of money for this trip... this may as well be a greyhound station.

✅ Trip Verified |   My recent flight from Washington, D.C. (DCA) to Philadelphia (PHL) with American Eagle, operated by PSA Airlines, was smooth and efficient. We experienced a minor maintenance delay, but on a 27-minute flight, it hardly made a difference. The crew was pleasant and professional, ensuring a comfortable experience. The aircraft, a CRJ-900, is the largest in PSA’s fleet, offering a bit more space compared to their other planes. Given the short duration of the flight, there’s really nothing to complain about it was a quick, easy, and well-handled trip. Great job PSA!

✅ Trip Verified |   My Husband and I traveled on American Airlines Flight AA3089 to New York from Florida. We were extremely pleased traveling home on this plane. This was mainly due to Flight Attendant DeJon. DeJon made sure we were comfortable, asked us what drinks we wanted, and served us snacks and a very nice lunch. Mostly, he was so congenial and I could see he was working so hard taking care of the passengers. My Husband and I are seniors and I can honestly say that we very much appreciated DeJon. It made our flight enjoyable, and we were glad we flew with American Airlines.

Not Verified | I had two flights booked between St. Louis and Chicago to meet up with friends for a vacation flight out of Chicago. There was impending weather, snow. I changed my flight on February 12 in the evening to 3:10 in the afternoon in order to get to Chicago in time for the next morning flight. I had to pay an additional $188 to change the flight. The flight was cancelled by the airline and I ended up on the same flight I was originally booked on! That flight was delayed but I did get to Chicago late Wednesday night. They refused to reimburse me for the extra amount paid for the cancelled flight! I should not have had to pay that fee when they cancelled the flight! On the way back to St. Louis there was potential weather. However, our flight from Mexico got into O'Hare with no problem. But my flight from Chicago to St. Louis had been delayed earlier that morning and there were no flights out of O'Hare (according the the RUDE American Airlines person) so I had to either sit in the airport for 13 hours or pay for a room - they refused to get me a room! They claimed weather as an excuse but there was no weather they had just tried to out-guess it and got it wrong. So I had to pay for a room, my bag again the next day because it couldn't be transferred, an extra day of parking and an extra day of care for my pet - $309! No customer service. Their supervisor was also uncaring and rude. I ended up falling on an escalator trying to get my bags around by myself due to them!!

Not Verified | Overnight flight was delayed twice for not enough crew and then no crew. Still no guarantee it will take off. Had to buy blankets, $60, and kids sleeping on the disgustingly dirty floor. Trying to get to a family member before they pass. How can you stay in business with this poor customer service? Your company needs a major overhaul. Someone has to be held accountable.

✅ Trip Verified |   Horrible experience. The online check-in didn’t work and the airport check-in experience was super complicated and took 1.5h so we almost missed our flight. My partner & I were assigned separate seats even though we were on the same booking. The agents there were very accommodating and were doing their best given the system restrictions. Apparently, the system didn’t recognize that we were only transiting in India and needed us to submit a visa for India which is not needed for transit. The agents specifically told us that it’s good that we didn’t bring checked luggage because we cannot leave the transit area. The agents at the gate forced us to give up the luggage under the premise that we would receive them directly when we exit the plane. There was lots of space on the plane to put carry-on luggage. Upon arrival, of course, our luggage was not there and the New Delhi staff told us we needed to pick up the luggage at the belt. So now, we can‘t receive the luggage and have been stuck at the airport for 2h at this point and missed our connecting flight while they‘re trying to figure out the situation. Also, our initial AA flight was 2h delayed as well. No food vouchers or any other compensation offered. Better communication and coordination among their teams would be appreciated for an airline that calls itself American Airlines.

✅ Trip Verified |   My wife and I had a 1-stop flight from DFW to St Thomas, with a connecting flight out of Miami. Both flights, DFW to Miami and Miami to St Thomas were through American Airlines. Out flight from DFW to Miami was delayed by 2 hours due to mechanical failure, and all passengers were put on a different plane. The new flight landed in Miami 10 minutes before our connecting flight (Miami to St Thomas) took off, but American couldn't delay their flight 5 minutes to allow 9 passengers to make the last connecting flight out of St Thomas. So basically, we were stuck in Miami for the night and were booked on the first flight (8:30 am) the next morning. We were offered a hotel voucher at a cheap airport hotel; which was a far cry from the beach front resort that we had purchased (priced by the hotel at $620/night). My wife and I also had checked the bags with all of our clothes, so we didn't have a change of clothes until we reached our destination (St Thomas). On the next day we reached arrived at our gate early, but were told that our flight had been delayed due to weather and that we would be flying out 7 hours later. We later found out that this was a lie, and that really the cause for delay was that an emergency landing had been made on St Thomas' only landing strip, and that an hour and a half cleanup of the landing strip was required. All other airlines resumed flights within 2 hours. So, we spent another 7 hours in the airport waiting for our flight. All-in we spent 24 hours stuck in Miami without a change of clothes, most of it spent in the airport, when a 5-miute delay of one flight (that was on time) could have solved their own failure entirely. American Airlines' first attempt at compensation was to offer my wife and I 2500 aa points each. If you figure those points are worth about $0.01, then the total value of their compensation was $50 = 2 x 0.01 x 2500. After writing them an email explaining that I am prepared to take them to small claims court, they offered me and my wife each $100 travel vouchers. After I denied again, they offered us each $150 travel vouchers. After I denied again, they apologized but said there was no other offer. I also asked how much money American made on the sale of our seats, and they said the representative said he didn't know. Basically, American Airlines believes they are entitled to screw you over and doesn't care to compensate you for damages whatsoever. Not only that, everyone of their agents (rebooking/gate) are entitled and have a terrible attitude. Personally, I have no desire to fly with them again as any trust in this company's capacity to conduct honest business has been eviscerated.

Not Verified |  American airlines is the only carrier that supports flights into Yuma, AZ, and with my employer always booking work trips with them, and my family needing to use them out of Yuma, we unfortunately fly with them everytime. There is an issue with delays, maintenance, forced rebooking, sitting on the taxiway both prior to takeoff and after, at least 80% of the time. It is not an exaggeration. It's mind blowing how they are never held accountable for terrible service and especially at the prices they charge. Too many times I've found myself in a dead sprint in the airport (Phoenix, Charlotte, Dallas, Philidelphia) trying to make my gate because of this poorly run business.

✅ Trip Verified |   Seat Comfort was excellent. Legroom was excellent. The hard product is very good. The soft product is abysmal and food is unacceptable. Communication is poor. The staff is truly detached from their customers. Not just the flight attendants, but the gate agents and counter personnel. It seems like they don’t want to be at their job jobs. So detached that when we landed in Madrid, the purser welcomed us to Paris, France. I almost always fly British Airways. This time a segment was on American. Never again.

✅ Trip Verified |   Terrible experience. First flight was delayed, forcing me to not walk but sprint to my connection which was on the total opposite side of the airport. And when I arrived at the ticket scanning desk, was met with an extremely rude attendant who gave me quite the attitude when she clearly saw that I was huffing and puffing in order to make this connection. She made me check my small suitcase at the gate because it “wasn’t gonna fit” in overhead storage. Meanwhile there was plenty of overhead space upon entering plane. This is important to remember for later. The second flight was fine, but after landing, made my way over to baggage claim after being met with, again, a very rude and dismissive agent who informed me that they put my suitcase with all the other large checked bags. Well, now I have been waiting at baggage claim 9 at JFK for over an hour with no sight of any suitcases. Not mine, not anyone’s! And quite honestly this is not what I needed after an exhausting work trip on a Saturday evening. I have serious beef with you American Airlines and will not be using you ever again.

✅ Trip Verified |   Another horrible experience with AA. First you oversold the flight (again), which caused my wife and I to be the last two ticketed passengers for the flight despite the fact I purchased the tickets over 3 months prior and attempted to check in early. And while we barely made the flight, it caused a significant amount of stress to ourselves and our traveling party since we were the trip leaders of our group. Then you made us check our carry on baggage (which had become a common problem with AA for us), which caused additional problems at our layover since my wife had put her passport in her carry on. And when we finally were able to board, we discovered that there was plenty of room for more carry ons (one overhead bin was completely empty, plus other spaces). On our return flight, we were again required to check our carry on baggage and upon boarding found there was, again, plenty of remain space for bags. This made us run tight for our layover coming back to the US and required us to wait FORTY-FIVE MINUTES for our "carry on" baggage at our final destination, which was almost a midnight arrival already ( thanks to a 1 hr delay). As icing on the cake, the flight attendants from PUJ to ORD were quite testy with passengers and even each other. Overall, what a fun story to tell my friends. You guys need to change some policies.

✅ Trip Verified |   My husband developed a high fever mid-flight, and despite informing the crew, not a single member offered assistance. No temperature check, no hydration, not even basic concern. I was left to tend to him, using a cold towel on his head while the crew ignored us.  When I approached them again a crew member rolled their eyes, made a face, and sarcastically muttered, “Oh, perfect. What do you need now?”. A high fever in a pressurized cabin is a serious concern, yet they acted as if we were nothing but a burden. They handed out meals with no regard for meal preferences and both times, I ended up with nothing because they ran out of choices.  I repeatedly asked for hot water for my husband. One crew member said, “I don’t have it on the cart.” Another promised to bring it but never came back. Yet this same crew member walked past my seat multiple times, ignoring me. The crew on this flight were rude, dismissive, and downright incompetent.  This was, the most emotionally draining, physically exhausting 14 hours of my life.

Not Verified |  I wanted to make a review for American Airlines flight crew member Kimo. He was our flight attendant from Fayetteville Regional Airport while on our way to Hawaii.  He was exceptionally lovely, fun, and caring! This tiny plane flight went from Fayettville to Charlotte, and even with the flight being so short, he gave us water. I am pregnant and he was extra caring for me to give me water and pretzels to help with the nausea. Thank you Kimo for being such a great part of my flight experience!

Not Verified |  Flew out of Albany Flight 440 2/13/25. Customer service atrocious. Check in was nice that’s all, but boarding attendants and flight attendants were the rudest people I’ve ever encountered. Not family oriented. Seems like they tried to make my trip harder with a toddler. Everything seemed like a bother. Asking us if we wanted a drink or snack annoyed them. Literally if you dislike people and want to ruin someone’s day apply to American Airlines.

Not Verified | I paid for an exit row seat in Premium Economy for the DFW to Seattle leg. The flight was missed due to mechanical issues. The surly gate agent issuing my ticket for a later flight informed me that although I was not in an exit row seat or Premium Economy, the price difference would be refunded. She lied. This never happened and when contacting customer service I was denied a refund. This is not the first time I’ve had issues with this paltry excuse for an airline. Delayed flights are standard as is a subpar onboard experience, including their onboard entertainment never working. In short, I will avoid flying them if there are any other airline options and would encourage others to do the same.

Very pleasent experience. Charlotte airport easy to manage, easy check in and fast security line. Admirals Club available but not as good as the premiere lounges in NYC and MIA. Boarding on time, by groups. Once on board, crew nice but nothing special, seat very comfortable for PE, nice amenity kit. Service ok, hot towel to start with, then drinks and dinner. All in nice served and well managed by crew. IFE very good selection. Manage +4 hrs of sleep on a 7hr flight, so really good. Did not have breakfast since I was sleeping, no comment on that. Recommend this airline.

Not Verified |  The seating was ridiculous. My husband's knees we against the seat in front of him for the entire flight. The plane was late, then we sat on the runway in Miami for 2 hours waiting to taxi. The ac didn't function properly. Heat was blowing out for 1 hr of the flight ... when it is 80 degrees outside. The flight attendants were very helpful during a medical issue, which was truly a blessing. Everything else was horrendous.

Not Verified |  Should have read the reviews before we booked. Gate changed 2 times and delayed 4 times causing us to miss our connecting flight and now we have to wait 18 hours for the next one with no access to checked baggage so no clothes and toiletries. Nearly every flight around us was expecting delays. Had a timer saying boarding in 15 mins when plane had not even arrived in the terminal yet. What's the point of timers if you're just going to lie. Not just the delays were the issue, the service desk only had 1 person working with a line of 15 people waiting due to multiple delays. Horrible service, will never fly with them again. This was our 4th flight this month have flown delta, united and Alaska airlines and all were so much better.

✅ Trip Verified | Very happy with my first time flying with American Airlines. Boarding process was speedy, and we found ourselves very lucky as there were only 57 passengers on board allowing everyone to spread around the aircraft and have the chance to lie down for what turned out to be a longer than usual, 8 hour 15 minutes flight. Soon after take-off the crew came by with a hot meal, with a choice of either vegetarian pasta or a rice and chicken dish. I opted for the latter and it was surprisingly delicious. Around 2 hours before landing the crew came around again to hand some ice cream, and then they serviced us one more time shortly before landing to give everyone a hot pocket. The cabin crew were very nice and attentive, and throughout the whole flight walked around the cabin to ensure everyone was comfortable. Overall, quite happy with my experience and will fly American Airlines again in the future if I have the opportunity.

Not Verified | I have experienced unforeseen travel situations with other airlines, including United and Southwest, both of which showed empathy and flexibility. Even though my tickets were nonrefundable, they worked with me to either change my flights for free or issue a full credit or refund. Their customer service demonstrated genuine care for their customers and valued loyalty. American Airlines, on the other hand, has shown me exactly why I will never book with them again. I found myself in an awkward situation needing to cancel a non-refundable flight that was meant to be a gift. Rather than allowing the full credit to be transferred to the recipient, American Airlines deducted the $99 cancellation fee from the credit (per their policy)—a fee that amounts to nearly half the cost of the original ticket. Instead of showing even the smallest amount of understanding, American Airlines rigidly clung to its policy, offering no meaningful assistance. The $99 fee has effectively diminished the value of what was supposed to be a thoughtful gift. This experience has not only been disappointing but feels needlessly punitive. I want to be clear: this situation wasn’t entirely within my control. I didn’t choose to book with American Airlines, nor was I the one to purchase the group flights without considering refundability. (We have a group of 15 with all flights booked at once by someone in the group who was trying to help out.) Yet somehow, I’m the one penalized because American Airlines refuses to provide flexibility in situations that clearly call for some level of human empathy. For context, I travel frequently—4 to 5 domestic trips per month for work—and I’ve been researching airline credit cards to decide which one best fits my needs as a frequent flyer. This may have been an inexpensive This may have been an inexpensive, leisurely trip, but with my business expense card, I'm enabled to travel business class for 3 to 6 trips per month. I can say with certainty that I will not be choosing American Airlines. This experience has solidified my preference for other airlines that consistently prioritize customer service, loyalty, and common sense. To anyone reading this, I urge you to think carefully before booking with American Airlines. There are plenty of other carriers that offer better customer service and greater flexibility when “life happens.” American Airlines may not care about losing a customer like me, but if they’re wondering why they don’t command the loyalty of frequent travelers, this situation should provide some insight. Goodbye, American Airlines. You’ve lost not just one potential loyal customer but also my trust and recommendation.

✅ Trip Verified |   I flew American Airlines Flagship First from Sydney to New York. The flight from Sydney was fantastic with a great and attentive crew, excellent food and a super comfortable ly-flat bed. Took so long for the luggage that I barely made my connecting flight to New York. Domestic First Class seats on the A321 are a bit claustrophobic and not so comfortable - only 1 flight attendant for 10 pax but he tried his best and the food was average. SYD to LAX = 9/10 LAX to JFK = 6/10

✅ Trip Verified |   American Airlines again fails to be on time and flight attendants are just rude. Every flight I took on this trip was delayed. We have tried to give them another chance but this is the last time we will be flying American.

✅ Trip Verified |   American Airlines messed up our itinerary to St. Croix, now we have to spend the night sleeping on the concrete floor somewhere in San Juan airport until the first flight at 7am. All the hotels in San Juan are fully booked and nothing available. Rotten start to our vacation. Plus they have lost our luggage. This is the second time American Airlines has ruined a vacation leaving me stranded in a strange place

Not Verified |  Even though the flight was late and I paid for First class (not frequent flyer miles), they refused to allow me to enter the Admirals Club. While the service was good, I think the food made me sick. I've flown in coach on American and they tiniest, most cramped seats you can imagine. Shame on them for treating people like cattle.

✅ Trip Verified |   I consider American Airlines a world-class carrier with aspirations for excellence, so when I sat down at my seat and found the touch screen was not working. I thought, “Ok, it’s fine; this sometimes happens. This is okay.” Then I put my arm on the armrest and was surprised to see that the entire armrest was covered in duct tape, and I thought to myself, “Duct tape? really?!” If I rent a car, and upon getting in, find the seat is covered with duct tape, I would consider this unacceptable. So, for American Airlines, which has aspirations for excellence. My question is this: Is this acceptable?

Not Verified |  We were flying 2 legs with American airlines: DTW (Detroit) to DFW (Dallas), DFW to MEX (Mexico city). On the way there, our flight was delayed, and we just barely got to our other flight in time. then, they lost our checked luggage. the worst part is, we were flying with another airline to another destination in Mexico, and simply couldn't wait. The airline staff was either rude, or they didn't know what they were talking about for our lost luggage. The airline then took 2-4 days to get it back to us, near the end of our trip. they also refused to answer our phone calls to customer service. we sat, on hold, for over 5 hours just for them to hang up. On our way back, we got stranded in DFW and it was American airlines' fault! It was a real hassle due to their truly awful customer service.
Not Verified |  Sonya at the MBJ Counter of American Airlines was attentive and addressed my concerns professionally, and in a timely manner. She is definitely an asset to the organization.

✅ Trip Verified |   This was an awful experience. Avoid American Airlines at all costs. First, they changed our itinerary and forced us to add 3 hours flight time and a 4 hour layover to our trip. Next, our flight was delayed due to mechanical issues with the plane but they wouldn't tell us what was happening they just continued to delay for short periods of time so we couldn't leave the gate area and couldn't make other arrangements. Then they announced a new gate, new aircraft and boarding time and again started announcing delays without explanation. The second plane was eventually taken out of service as unrepairable and a third gate and flight was assigned. This time they let us now the departure time was uncertain because they didn't have a crew (it was Thanksgiving and getting late). We finally got them to agree to change our reservation to another airline with a flight leaving later in the evening and they assured us that they would transfer our baggage because they had over an hour and a half. In total, we spent over thirteen hours in Dallas/Ft. Worth airport, our original 4 hour layover and an additional 9 hour delay. Our arrival in Madrid, originally scheduled for early the next morning ended up being 2:30 in the afternoon and we still had to wait for the baggage which, of course, did not make it onto our flight. One whole day in Madrid gone. After i posted a complaint with American Airlines I received one phone message from someone who never returned my phone calls and several apologetic messages without any offers of compensation or resolution. Ultimately they gave me 7500 air miles while they researched my claim and in keeping with their policy of customer neglect, no real satisfaction. I will certainly never fly American again.

✅ Trip Verified |   My nephew and I traveled to Cuba and we were overcharged $165 each for a bags that they considered overweight or oversized, even though, their website states the following: “Each passenger traveling to Cuba may only check up to 2 bags* with a maximum weight of 70 lbs / 32 kgs per bag, plus 1 carry-on bag and 1 personal item” Trips originating outside Cuba. Bag 1 Bag 2 Bag 3 To Cuba. $0 / $35*^ $150 / $200**^ $200 They charged $400 for each of us. I have different phone calls and they refused to get back our money. On top of that, last phone call they hang out. On top of that, they left behind a check in bag in miami when returning back, the bag was broken and also refused to pay what it cost. It was a bad experience and I hope I don’t have to travel with them anymore.
✅ Trip Verified |   Very rude staff at YYZ and even worse at MIA. They have no manners in speaking with passengers. Very impatient with seniors that required assistance using the totems to check in.

✅ Trip Verified |   This airline is awful. They have no regard for you as a passenger. We are delayed 30 hours and counting. Just as we are preparing for take off on a 15 hour flight, the Captain realizes he is over his hours. Now we sit on the plane and wait for a new Captain? I had a similar experience returning from Peru in August 2024. The most frustrating part is the complete indifference towards the passengers. I was a loyal customer. Now I just hate this company and will do my best to avoid them in the future.

Not Verified | Multiple flight changes without any notice of gate or flight change. Left New Orleans at 3 am, it is now 8.45pm and still waiting on a delayed flight. 6 of the American Airlines flights are delayed at this time. Will never fly American again, would rather rent a car and drive for days. Will try Delta next time. Pathetic customer service.

Not Verified |  We left 2 hours late, then diverted to Tulsa with no explanation. Left sitting on the plane for 10 hours with no food and no water. They did not help us find or even offer to help find ways to our destination We lost our once in a lifetime trip, NFL game tickets and hotel. We were given no hotel voucher and no flight home. We were stranded in Dallas, had to rent a car to drive home and pay for our hotel. There is no person you can talk to because they don't have a phone number to even call customer service. I will absolutely never fly AA again.

Not Verified |  
I tagged my luggage, as we were boarding I noticed my luggage was left behind. The stewardess just said I don't know what to tell you. I had noticed way before & asked before we boarded. ✅ Trip Verified | I purchased a Flagship 1st Class ticket for a long haul, lie flat seat to Rome from Dallas. After the flight reached a safe altitude to adjust our seats, the captain allowed us to unbuckle our seatbelts and walk around the cabin. I realized my electronic control panel was not working and I was unable to move my seat. I called Michelle and Mats, the flight attendants serving our area, and notified them of the issue. Michelle let me know the seat was known to be broken and could not be adjusted through the control panel due to a power failure. Any seat manipulation would require it to be done manually by two flight attendants. I requested another seat due to seeing a couple available, and she informed me they were for the cabin crew. So, I let her know I needed to figure something out due to my seat being broken. She then requested another attendant to help her manually move the seat, and after attempting this, the seat jammed and was left pushed forward with the seat back leaning forward, as well. For the entire duration of the flight, 10+hours, I was unable to sit upright, recline, nor was I able to use any electronic functionality of my seat. Furthermore, due to the seat being stuck leaning forward, the tray table to eat was also unable to be opened, so I had an issue with dining. Michelle realized this was an issue and contacted American Airlines Customer Relations during the flight to request they reach out to me about this ordeal. Michelle let me know that AA knows about damaged seats and plane issues but were opting to wait for major renovations to their fleet in October. I questioned why they would sell a premium seat knowing the seat was damaged, and she told me it is a known frustration throughout multiple flight attendants. No matter what, American will not refund my money.

✅ Trip Verified |   I booked a flight from Colombia to Washington State with American Airlines, which included an 11-hour journey with a 1-hour and 35-minute layover in Miami. I had never encountered such a counter before, but it turns out they have at least two, staffed by 4-5 employees, likely due to frequent rebookings. There was even a sign indicating that they often overbook flights. They managed to book me on a flight the next morning that would stop in Dallas, arriving in Seattle at 3 PM the following day. When I asked to speak with the manager, she was dismissive and told me that they were only legally obligated to provide a layover of between 90 minutes and 2 hours. She added that if I had been flying to Canada or the UK, they would have had to provide hotel accommodations and meals, but because my final destination was within the U.S., they had no obligation to assist me. She insisted I should feel fortunate to be rebooked at all. This led to a long night spent at Miami airport. The next morning, my flight to Dallas was delayed on the tarmac for over two hours because one of the engines wouldn't start, necessitating a mechanic's intervention. As a result, I arrived in Dallas 15 minutes after my connecting flight had left. I had to return to the rebooking counter yet again, where I finally secured a new flight for 5 PM. Ultimately, I arrived home a full 21 hours later than my original schedule.

✅ Trip Verified |   There are two airlines that fly from Philadelphia to Seattle non-stop in the afternoons, Alaska or American. I do love American Airlines mobile app. You don't need to print boarding passes, you can purchase your checked baggage ahead of time. Best of all, if you need to make a transfer in a confusing or large airport, they provide a step by step map for you. This was a life saver for me on the return trip to Philly which first stopped in DFW. The flight from Seattle left a half hour late, which caused me some minor anxiety on the way to DFW (because there was only a 40 minute gap between the 2 flights on a normal schedule). ✅ Trip Verified |   San Francisco to Dallas Fort Worth onboard their Airbus A321. Check-in was no-nonsense; all I needed was to print my bag tag and boarding pass, take my bags to a dedicated counter, show my ID, and I was off to my gate in no time. The flight was delayed by 20-ish minutes, but then we were soon on our way. They deployed their usual A321EOW with larger overhead bins, LED lighting, and Collins Meridian seats. While the cabin was comfortable and in good condition, it was rather dirty with lots of leftover trash behind, crumbs, gunk, and grime embedded in the carpet and seats. The seat was rich in contents, with charging ports and 2 literature storage items. It was pretty easy to recline too, and the legroom was decent. Once we took off, the IFE kicked in, and the Wi-Fi-based IFE was super speedy. It loaded most content without issues, and I had no trouble streaming YouTube content, texting friends and family, and accessing several sites. The cabin crews were a bit of a letdown; except for two, all of them looked tired, depressed, and unmotivated; one was even rude towards an old Cantonese-speaking grandma when she inadvertently opened her tray table before taking off. One of the crews who was friendly, who I presume was a Korean, admitted this by saying "We are dying, actually" - which I understand since it is not easy to work on a red-eye like this, however, I believe they could have been much friendlier and better at communicating; although I could feel their presence for the entire 2.5-hour flight. The landing was surprisingly early; 6 minutes ahead of schedule, and I didn't have to wait for long for my bags to arrive. Overall, despite the crews falling a bit short and the dirty cabin, it was still a pleasant red-eye flight; however, I believe American's level is higher than this, and this flight isn't the American that I know.

✅ Trip Verified |  Dallas Fort Worth to San Francisco onboard their Airbus A321. My previous flight with American was good but I couldn't find the "punch" factor that made American Airlines special. This time, I was surprised that American Airlines had become so excellent. Check-in at DFW was done in a very fast manner, and maybe because I arrived way too early, I experienced 6 gate changes - from A16, then B7, B9, B11, C29, then C12 (thank Goodness DFW had a reliable Skylink). However, that was pretty much the end of my moan because once I stepped on the plane for boarding, I was welcomed by a (surprisingly) very energetic set of crews who smiled at and greeted me. I soon proceeded to my seat, 18A, which was pretty much basic with no IFE screen, but it had USB charging ports, universal power sockets, some literature items, and a decent amount of legroom and padding. The cabin, featuring larger overhead bins like the ones in the A321neo, was spacious, comfortable, and in its best condition despite the toilets being inoperable for short flights cruising under 16000ft (we cruised at twice that altitude, so no issues). The Wi-Fi was blazingly fast and the entertainment had plenty of contents that were up-to-date and beautifully laid out. The pretzels and drinks provided on the flight were delicious. Throughout the flight, the cabin crews remained passionate, friendly, cheerful, and lovely. This might be a little bit overboard of me to say, but the crews of this flight were on par with the Japan Airlines and Starlux Airlines crews that I met. We took off from DFW an hour behind schedule due to a changing traffic flow control, and landed at SFO just 25-ish minutes behind schedule, allowing me plenty of time to catch my connecting flight. American has continued to surprise me for the better, and as an AAdvantage member, this flight affirms my loyalty and love towards them.

✅ Trip Verified |  I've flown with American Airlines numerous times over the years and have generally regarded them as a top-tier airline, offering excellent service and a comfortable flying experience. However, my recent encounter at the airport on March 1st has left a blemish on what I've always considered a reliable choice for air travel. American Airlines has seemingly adopted a new policy where their staff are directed not to assist customers directly unless through the use of the airline's mobile app. This approach felt incredibly impersonal and contrary to the warm service I've come to expect. Observing staff members choosing to wear headphones and dismiss passenger inquiries directly contradicts the essence of customer service. This shift towards a more detached interaction is not only disappointing but signals a worrying trend in their service philosophy. Moreover, my dismay was further compounded when reviewing the safety brochures provided onboard. It appears American Airlines has taken to only labeling their aircraft as "737," omitting any mention of it being a Boeing or the specific variant number. This choice strikes me as a deliberate attempt to obscure the exact model of the aircraft from passengers, perhaps out of embarrassment or a misguided attempt to sidestep potential scrutiny. This lack of transparency is not just a matter of corporate image; it directly impacts passenger safety by not fully informing them about the aircraft they are flying in. Despite these criticisms, it's important to note that my experiences with American Airlines have overwhelmingly been positive, outside of these specific incidents. The quality of their flights, the professionalism of most of their staff, and the overall flying experience remain commendable. It's disheartening to see such an esteemed airline let down by policies that seem to prioritize image over direct human interaction and safety transparency. It is my hope that American Airlines will reconsider these practices. There's immense value in honest communication with passengers and in maintaining the high standard of service that has defined them for years. Addressing these issues would not only enhance their reputation but also reaffirm their commitment to passenger safety and satisfaction.

Their contract only covers united and delta diversions and they don’t see these options in their system. Ok, can the customer service team escalate? No… if it’s not on their computer screen, there’s nothing they can do. And I have top tier one world status, would hate to not have status. I’ve had this situation happen before, American somehow took possession of a British airways reservation during a check in screw up by their agent last year which meant BA could not physically check me into the flight that I was supposed to be on. the phone agent in the UK for American successfully diverted me to a virgin flight to help rectify the mistake that would have kept me in London several extra days due to flight schedules and availability. Crisis averted, the agent went above and beyond and fixed the mistake. These American agents stateside would not hear of such a thing, they don’t call other airlines. I ask to speak to a supervisor. They take around 15 minutes and then get back on the phone and just tell me “this is so and so, she will explain how things work to you.” Probably the worst phrase you could say to a frustrated customer and a basic customer service mistake. Basically, “I’m not going to listen to you, you listen to me.” Awesome. So now I’m on with the supervisor, and she repeats his lines. Not willing to call. If it’s not on her screen it doesn’t exist to American despite flight availability online. And he was their chief advisor so if her employee couldn’t figure it out, no one could. I fear for those that get the non customer advisor customer service people. She isn’t able to help, I’ll deal with it at the airport. At the airport, our checkin person was probably new as she had to ask for help a number of times, but we had a weird situation and she did her best. She was very polite. We accept that we need to fly out the next morning and they’ll put us up at a hotel in Dallas during our layover. We land at 7:20 and are out at an airport holiday inn, which is fine. They have a shuttle, great. We call for the shuttle, it’s going to be 15 to 20 minutes. Not Americans fault on this part, but we were picked up an hour later and then drive around the airport for another hour before heading to the hotel. Not joking. We check in at 10:30. Just insult to injury at this point. We eat some cold delivery dinner and try to get some Zs. Never again American. Well pay extra to fly with anyone else.

It allowed me to browse anything, open social media apps, and watch videos on the ground for around 20 minutes. Once I took off, the social media apps and browsing feature no longer existed, but live TV shows, videos, movies, and games were provided through the American Airlines portal. The signal strength was quite poor, but the contents and the layout of the portal were incredibly good. Despite landing 30 minutes ahead of schedule, the baggage delivery at Dallas Fort Worth was ridiculously slow, causing me to wait around 45-60 minutes. Overall, my experience and first impression onboard American Airlines was somewhat impressive. Also, if you're asking for help, contact them via Twitter or use the Live Chat feature. The seats were typical for a US-based carrier's economy product. The IFE had many choices and was easy to navigate (though, my one complaint here is a lack of appealing music choices; I was looking for classic rock and/or 1960s and 70s pop (Beatles, Stones, Journey, Styx, Wings, ELO, etc.) and their selections included songs and artists I've never heard of). The catering was good; biscoff cookies on the domestic segments and a full meal and snacks on the trans-Atlantic segments. AA offered a choice of 2 meals on both international segments. Along with the entree, the meal tray includes a bottle of cold water, a small salad with an olive oil-based dressing, a roll with butter, crackers and cheese, and a brownie for dessert. Overall the main meals were satisfying. Especially enjoyable was the main meal on the FCO-PHL segment; it was a chicken dish with mashed potatoes and vegetables and was one of the most delicious Y meals that I've had in 46 years of travel! I will not hesitate to fly with AA again.

Not Verified |  My flight experience per the route noted and on my return from Phoenix through Charlotte to Harrisburg were uneventful and pleasant. In fear of hiccups, I made sure my carry-on had everything I needed in the event my luggage didn't make the trip. I put an air tag in my luggage just for my own peace of mind. But the app also enabled me to know that my luggage was on board, so when I went to the baggage claim, I knew it was coming out eventually. No stress. Honestly, all my flights were early upon arrival and I had no issues whatsoever with luggage. The in-flight crew was very friendly and helpful. Seriously, no bad vibes from anyone at all. In a day and age where you're sort of at the mercy of what you hear/read internet or other news, and when that news tends to spotlight everything that's wrong with our world, I would not have been surprised to witness or hear people being rude to each other, to staff, or just in general. ✅ Trip Verified | Flew to Boston from DFW (roundtrip) for a wedding in early December. There were no delays on either outbound or inbound flight. Outbound flight on A321 Premium Economy seat. Enough legroom for a comfortable flight. Bathrooms are smaller than on the 737-800. Inbound flight to DFW was on 737-800. The premium economy seat had plenty of legroom. Service is typical (biscotti, snack and soft drinks) of all domestic flights. No issues on either flight. ICE worked just fine.
